page.title: 06A Featherstone Councillor
page.content:
Keith Wilson was born in Normanton in 1945,he came to live in Featherstone in 1967 when he got married.He is a lecturer at Bradford college and he is leader of the county council.In 1982-3
he was the Mayor of Featherstone and went to Wembley when Featherstone Rovers won the cup and the team invited him to join in the celebration after the match.He is chairman of the environment committee and at the moment he is getting the Coal Board to remove the huge pit tip in north Featherstone to turn the area back to farming land.Mr Wilson is on the board of governors at six local schools.He is always busy going to meetings both locally and away from home but still finds time to do such things as opening church garden parties as he did this year at All Saints church.
